channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Comedian Tig Notaro on finding humor in the heaviest of moments
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Tig Notaro talks about admiring the way her friend handled death.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Comedian Tig Notaro talks about admiring the way her friend handled death.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: 'Starfleet Academy' brings a modern sheen to the 'Star Trek' universe
item.description: Viewers without any Star Trek expertise can enjoy the new adventures out of context. But there are echoes and Easter eggs throughout this Paramount+ series, for those who catch them.
item.content:encoded: Viewers without any Star Trek expertise can enjoy the new adventures out of context. But there are echoes and Easter eggs throughout this Paramount+ series, for those who catch them.
item.dc:creator: David Bianculli

item.title: Jodie Foster plans more French roles after 'A Private Life'
item.description: Jodie Foster has spoken French since she was a child. But it's only now that she's taken on a lead role scripted almost entirely in the language of Molière, for A Private Life.
item.content:encoded:
Jodie Foster has spoken French since she was a child. But it's only now that she's taken on a lead role scripted almost entirely in the language of Molière, for A Private Life.

(Image credit: Jérôme Prébois)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: 'A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms' is 'Game of Thrones' for the haters
item.description: There are no dragons, no maps and no internecine family trees in this Game of Thrones prequel about an underdog knight and his would-be squire.
item.content:encoded:
There are no dragons, no maps and no internecine family trees in this Game of Thrones prequel about an underdog knight and his would-be squire.

(Image credit: Steffan Hill)
item.dc:creator: Glen Weldon

item.title: Gen Z is taking up 'granny core' hobbies to unwind
item.description: A growing number of young people are getting involved in what are traditionally considered "grandma hobbies," like knitting, to relax.
item.content:encoded: A growing number of young people are getting involved in what are traditionally considered "grandma hobbies," like knitting, to relax.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Julian Barnes says he's enjoying himself, but that 'Departure(s)' is his last book
item.description: Part memoir and part fiction, Barnes' hybrid novel publishes the day after his 80th birthday. He's been living with a rare form of blood cancer for six years.
item.content:encoded:
Part memoir and part fiction, Barnes' hybrid novel publishes the day after his 80th birthday. He's been living with a rare form of blood cancer for six years.

(Image credit: Stuart C. Wilson)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: 'Starfleet Academy' interrogates the values at the center of 'Star Trek' itself
item.description: It's not quite clear what the latest Trek series wants to be: a rollicking adventure, a college coming-of-age story, or a bizarre blend of both?
item.content:encoded:
It's not quite clear what the latest Trek series wants to be: a rollicking adventure, a college coming-of-age story, or a bizarre blend of both?

(Image credit: John Medland)
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: 'I want to make tiny little movies that don't seem tiny,' says Kristen Stewart
item.description: In her feature-length directorial debut, actor Kristen Stewart adapts The Chronology of Water, the memoir of Lidia Yuknavitch, a competitive swimmer-turned-author who was abused as a child.
item.content:encoded:
In her feature-length directorial debut, actor Kristen Stewart adapts The Chronology of Water, the memoir of Lidia Yuknavitch, a competitive swimmer-turned-author who was abused as a child.

(Image credit: Emily Soto)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Julio Iglesias accused of sexual assault as Spanish prosecutors study the allegations
item.description: Spanish prosecutors are studying allegations that Grammy-winning singer Julio Iglesias sexually assaulted two former employees at his residences in the Dominican Republic and the Bahamas.
item.content:encoded:
Spanish prosecutors are studying allegations that Grammy-winning singer Julio Iglesias sexually assaulted two former employees at his residences in the Dominican Republic and the Bahamas.

(Image credit: Carlos Giusti)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Centuries-old 'Frank the Liberty Tree' gets cut down
item.description: People from Florida to Washington want a piece of Frank the Liberty Tree, a huge oak between 250 and 300 years old that was struck by lightning years ago and now must come down.
item.content:encoded: People from Florida to Washington want a piece of Frank the Liberty Tree, a huge oak between 250 and 300 years old that was struck by lightning years ago and now must come down.
item.dc:creator: Frank Morris
